metadata.title: Set Up Vitest Unit and Integration Test Harness

context.background: This task implements Set Up Vitest Unit and Integration Test Harness for Healio and is scoped as one atomic work item aligned to the PRD. It should be completed within 45 mins and leave clear evidence for follow-on tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Follow the PRD architecture/security conventions and keep outputs compatible with the Healio design system and response envelopes.

instruction.step: Implement the scoped changes for Set Up Vitest Unit and Integration Test Harness in the planned files (healio/vitest.config.ts, healio/tests/setup.ts, healio/package.json, healio/tests/unit ...) while preserving the PRD-aligned project structure.
Apply validation, error handling, and consistent response/UI behavior so the task output integrates cleanly with existing helpers and patterns.
Wire integrations and dependencies for this task (endpoints: none) and keep tenant scoping/RBAC/security expectations intact where applicable.
Add or update focused tests (unit/integration) for critical business rules, idempotency, or security behavior introduced by this task.
Document assumptions and any follow-on schema/API contracts in code comments or lightweight docs when they affect downstream tasks.

validation_checklist.check: Run lint/typecheck or the smallest relevant test suite for the files changed by this task.
Validate security/tenant behavior with at least one negative test or rejection scenario when applicable.
Record evidence of persistence/side effects (DB row change, log entry, webhook event handling, cache behavior, etc.) as applicable.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Set Up Vitest Unit and Integration Test Harness is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (8 Testing Strategy (Unit + Integration)) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Business rules, tenant scoping, and security constraints relevant to this task are enforced (validation, idempotency, RBAC, webhook/cron protection, etc.).
At least one verification artifact (test case, curl call, or fixture-driven check) proves the new behavior works and regressions are covered.

output_spec.commit_message: test(healio): vitest unit and integration harness

execution_tracking.verification_command: npm run typecheck; npm run test:unit:vitest
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Added a Vitest harness (`vitest.config.ts`, `tests/setup.ts`) with `@` alias support and updated npm scripts so Vitest can coexist with the existing `node:test` suite (`test:unit:node` + `test:unit:vitest`). Added a Vitest smoke test under `tests/unit/vitest` to verify configuration and alias resolution.

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, test commands, screenshots (UI tasks), and commit/PR references here.
Changed files: healio/package.json, healio/package-lock.json, healio/vitest.config.ts, healio/tests/setup.ts, healio/tests/unit/vitest/smoke.test.ts.
Harness verification: `npm run test:unit:vitest` passes and confirms Vitest execution + `@` alias import support.
Typecheck passed after script/config updates: `npm run typecheck`.
Scripts added for staged rollout: `test:unit:node`, `test:unit:vitest`, `test:integration`, and `test:watch` so existing node tests remain runnable while new Vitest integration coverage is added.
Feature commit: 18dd70a (feat(healio-qa): vitest unit and integration harness).

execution_tracking.completion_signal: Task is done only when state=DONE, is_done=true, completed_at is filled, verification_status=PASSED, and evidence records changed files/tests/screenshots as applicable.
